content.text: JavaScript HTML DOM - Changing HTML
The HTML DOM allows JavaScript to change the content of HTML elements.
content.html: The HTML DOM allows JavaScript to change the content of HTML elements.

content.text: Changing HTML Content
The easiest way to modify the content of an HTML element is by using the innerHTML property.
content.html: The easiest way to modify the content of an HTML element is by using the innerHTML property.

content.text: To change the content of an HTML element, use this syntax:
content.html: To change the content of an HTML element, use this syntax:

content.text:
This example changes the content of a

element:
content.html: This example changes the content of a <p> element:

content.code_html:
<html>
<body>

<p id="p1">Hello World!</p>

<script>
document.getElementById("p1").innerHTML = "New text!";
</script>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Example explained:
This example changes the content of an <h1> element:
content.html: This example changes the content of an <h1> element:

content.code: Old Heading
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<h1 id="id01">Old Heading</h1>

<script>
const element = document.getElementById("id01");
element.innerHTML = "New Heading";
</script>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Example explained:
Changing the Value of an Attribute
To change the value of an HTML attribute, use this syntax:
content.html: To change the value of an HTML attribute, use this syntax:

content.code_html: document.getElementById(id).attribute = new value

content.text: This example changes the value of the src attribute of an element:
content.html: This example changes the value of the src attribute of an <img> element:

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<img id="myImage" src="smiley.gif">

<script>
document.getElementById("myImage").src = "landscape.jpg";
</script>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Example explained:
Dynamic HTML content
JavaScript can create dynamic HTML content:
Date : Sun May 25 2025 18:02:44 GMT+0100 (Western European Summer Time)
content.html: Date : Sun May 25 2025 18:02:44 GMT+0100 (Western European Summer Time)

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<script>
document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = "Date : " + Date(); </script>

</body>
</html>

content.text: document.write()
In JavaScript, document.write() can be used to write directly to the HTML output stream:
content.html: In JavaScript, document.write() can be used to write directly to the HTML output stream:

content.code:
Bla bla bla

Bla bla bla
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<p>Bla bla bla</p>

<script>
document.write(Date());
</script>

<p>Bla bla bla</p>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Never use document.write() after the document is loaded. It will overwrite the document.
content.html: Never use document.write() after the document is loaded. It will overwrite the document.

content.html: What is a legal syntax for changing the content of an Element?
